description: antsAlignOrigin, applied to an input image, transforms it according to a reference image and a transform (or a set of transforms).

dimensionality.title: Dimensionality
dimensionality.description: This option forces the image to be treated as a specified-dimensional image. If not specified, antsWarp tries to infer the dimensionality from the input image.

input.title: Input image
input.description: Currently, the only input objects supported are image objects. However, the current framework allows for warping of other objects such as meshes and point sets.

reference_image.title: Reference image
reference_image.description: For warping input images, the reference image defines the spacing, origin, size, and direction of the output warped image.

output.title: Output
output.description: One can either output the warped image or, if the boolean is set, one can print out the displacement field based on the composite transform and the reference image.
